fastcpd 0.2.2

    Update the cost values for the segmentation. This function is not meant to be called directly by the user.

    cost_update.Rd

    Update the cost values for the segmentation. This function is not meant to be called directly by the user.

    Usage

    cost_update(
  data,
  theta_hat,
  theta_sum,
  hessian,
  tau,
  i,
  k,
  family,
  momentum,
  momentum_coef,
  epsilon,
  min_prob,
  winsorise_minval,
  winsorise_maxval,
  lambda,
  cost_gradient,
  cost_hessian
)

    Arguments

    data

    A data frame containing the data to be segmented.

    theta_hat

    Estimated theta from the previous iteration.

    theta_sum

    Sum of estimated theta from the previous iteration.

    hessian

    Hessian matrix from the previous iteration.

    tau

    Start of the current segment.

    i

    Index of the current data in the whole data set.

    k

    Number of epochs in SGD.

    family

    Family of the model.

    momentum

    Momentum from the previous iteration.

    momentum_coef

    Momentum coefficient to be applied to the current momentum.

    epsilon

    Epsilon to avoid numerical issues. Only used for binomial and poisson.

    min_prob

    Minimum probability to avoid numerical issues. Only used for poisson.

    winsorise_minval

    Minimum value to be winsorised. Only used for poisson.

    winsorise_maxval

    Maximum value to be winsorised. Only used for poisson.

    lambda

    Lambda for L1 regularization. Only used for lasso.

    cost_gradient

    Gradient for custom cost function.

    cost_hessian

    Hessian for custom cost function.

    Value

    A list containing new values of theta_hat, theta_sum,

    hessian, and momentum.

    On this page
